page.title: 02Derivation of Place names.
page.content: {Local History { }Belchamp with the 'ch' pronounced as 'sh' means good land or beautiful fields. The three out of four surviving Belchamps Otten, Walter and St Pauls (which is outside our area) are in an agricultural area which has been farmed for hundreds of years. Walter means great and Otten little. Belchamp Otten has always been smaller than Walter but in the last 100 years the population of both village has declined by 2/3rds, both local schools closing in this time. The names are said to be of saxon origin verified by the village of Belchamp St Ethelbert, St Ethelbert being a saxon saint. Belchamp is also said to mean on a ridge (a confusion of a French word) if you take the derivation as being French.
